00002 #define APPROXSIM_RESETTER

00009 #include "DataObject.h"
00010 #include "Resetter.h"
00011 #include "SimulationObject.h"
00012 #include "SOFactory.h"

00026 template<class T> class Resetter {
00027 public:
00028      static void reset(std::vector<T*>& simObjs, const std::vector<DataObject*>& dataObjs);
00029 };
00030 
00031 
00046 template<class T> void Resetter<T>::reset(std::vector<T*>& simObjs, const std::vector<DataObject*>& dataObjs)
00047 {
00048      std::map<const Reference*, SimulationObject*> objs;
00049 
00050      // Store SimulationObjects in map. 
00051      for (unsigned int i = 0; i < simObjs.size(); i++) {
00052           objs[&simObjs[i]->ref()] = simObjs[i];
00053      }
00054 
00055      // Clear original vector
00056      simObjs.clear();
00057 
00058      // 
00059      for (std::vector<DataObject*>::const_iterator it = dataObjs.begin(); it != dataObjs.end(); it++) {
00060           std::map<const Reference*, SimulationObject*>::iterator it2 = objs.find(&(*it)->ref());
00061           if (it2 != objs.end()) {
00062                // Object exists both in current and original state so let's reset it.
00063                it2->second->reset(**it);
00064                simObjs.push_back(dynamic_cast<T*>(it2->second));
00065                objs.erase(it2);
00066           }
00067           else {
00068                // Object existed in original state but not in current so let's create it.
00069                simObjs.push_back(dynamic_cast<T*>(SOFactory::createSimulationObject(*(*it)->clone())));
00070           }
00071      }
00072      for (std::map<const Reference*, SimulationObject*>::iterator it = objs.begin(); it != objs.end(); it++) {
00073           // Object exists in current state but not in the original so let's remove it.
00074           SOFactory::removeSimulationObject(it->second);
00075      }
00076 }
00077 
00078 #endif   // APPROXSIM_RESETTER
